titleStmt.title: A true relation of the twenty weeks siege of London derry, by the Scotch, Irish, and dis-affected English, with the daily proceeding passages thereof: as also the number of men killd, and taken prisoners on both sides. / Related in two letters from Captaine Henry Finch, one of the Captains of London derry, and one of the Aldermen of the city. To his friend in London.
titleStmt.author: Finch, Henry, Alderman of Londonderry.

titleStmt.title: A true relation of the twenty weeks siege of London derry, by the Scotch, Irish, and dis-affected English, with the daily proceeding passages thereof: as also the number of men killd, and taken prisoners on both sides. / Related in two letters from Captaine Henry Finch, one of the Captains of London derry, and one of the Aldermen of the city. To his friend in London.
titleStmt.author: Finch, Henry, Alderman of Londonderry.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.I. for S.G. and A.W. and are to bee sold at the Exchange, and at Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
